channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Automatic Quantification of Serial PET/CT Images for Pediatric Hodgkin Lymphoma Patients Using a Longitudinally-Aware Segmentation Network
item.description: For baseline segmentation, LAS-Net achieved a mean Dice score of 0. 772.

item.title: Probing the 3D Awareness of Visual Foundation Models
item.description: Given that such models can classify, delineate, and localize objects in 2D, we ask whether they also represent their 3D structure?

item.title: Lightweight Multi-System Multivariate Interconnection and Divergence Discovery
item.description: Identifying outlier behavior among sensors and subsystems is essential for discovering faults and facilitating diagnostics in large systems.

item.title: Dataset Reset Policy Optimization for RLHF
item.description: Motivated by the fact that offline preference dataset provides informative states (i. e., data that is preferred by the labelers), our new algorithm, Dataset Reset Policy Optimization (DR-PO), integrates the existing offline preference dataset into the online policy training procedure via dataset reset: it directly resets the policy optimizer to the states in the offline dataset, instead of always starting from the initial state distribution.

item.title: Joint Physical-Digital Facial Attack Detection Via Simulating Spoofing Clues
item.description: SPSC and SDSC augment live samples into simulated attack samples by simulating spoofing clues of physical and digital attacks, respectively, which significantly improve the capability of the model to detect "unseen" attack types.

item.title: Learning representations of learning representations
item.description: The ICLR conference is unique among the top machine learning conferences in that all submitted papers are openly available.

item.title: LaSagnA: Language-based Segmentation Assistant for Complex Queries
item.description: Recent advancements have empowered Large Language Models for Vision (vLLMs) to generate detailed perceptual outcomes, including bounding boxes and masks.

item.title: Masked Image Modeling as a Framework for Self-Supervised Learning across Eye Movements
item.description: To make sense of their surroundings, intelligent systems must transform complex sensory inputs to structured codes that are reduced to task-relevant information such as object category.

item.title: Pay Attention to Your Neighbours: Training-Free Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation
item.description: However, existing approaches often rely on impractical supervised pre-training or access to additional pre-trained networks.

item.title: Pre-training Small Base LMs with Fewer Tokens
item.description: Here we show that smaller LMs trained utilizing some of the layers of GPT2-medium (355M) and GPT-2-large (770M) can effectively match the val loss of their bigger counterparts when trained from scratch for the same number of training steps on OpenWebText dataset with 9B tokens.

item.title: Tackling Ambiguity from Perspective of Uncertainty Inference and Affinity Diversification for Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: When activating class objects, we argue that the false activation stems from the bias to the ambiguous regions during the feature extraction.

item.title: BoostTrack: boosting the similarity measure and detection confidence for improved multiple object tracking
item.description: To utilize low-detection score bounding boxes in one-stage association, we propose to boost the confidence scores of two groups of detections: the detections we assume to correspond to the existing tracked object, and the detections we assume to correspond to a previously undetected object.

item.title: Pathological Primitive Segmentation Based on Visual Foundation Model with Zero-Shot Mask Generation
item.description: Primitive detection and segmentation in digitized tissue samples are essential for objective and automated diagnosis and prognosis of cancer.

item.title: Evolutionary Preference Sampling for Pareto Set Learning
item.description: Recently, Pareto Set Learning (PSL) has been proposed for learning the entire Pareto set using a neural network.

item.title: The Integration of Semantic and Structural Knowledge in Knowledge Graph Entity Typing
item.description: The Knowledge Graph Entity Typing (KGET) task aims to predict missing type annotations for entities in knowledge graphs.

item.title: Mitigating Language-Level Performance Disparity in mPLMs via Teacher Language Selection and Cross-lingual Self-Distillation
item.description: Therefore, we introduce ALSACE to leverage the learned knowledge from the well-performing languages to guide under-performing ones within the same mPLM, eliminating the need for additional labeled multilingual data.

item.title: Hyperbolic Delaunay Geometric Alignment
item.description: Hyperbolic machine learning is an emerging field aimed at representing data with a hierarchical structure.

item.title: Synthetic Dataset Creation and Fine-Tuning of Transformer Models for Question Answering in Serbian
item.description: In this paper, we focus on generating a synthetic question answering (QA) dataset using an adapted Translate-Align-Retrieve method.

item.title: Counterfactual Explanations for Face Forgery Detection via Adversarial Removal of Artifacts
item.description: We verify the effectiveness of the proposed explanations from two aspects: (1) Counterfactual Trace Visualization: the enhanced forgery images are useful to reveal artifacts by visually contrasting the original images and two different visualization methods; (2) Transferable Adversarial Attacks: the adversarial forgery images generated by attacking the detection model are able to mislead other detection models, implying the removed artifacts are general.

item.title: A Large Scale Survey of Motivation in Software Development and Analysis of its Validity
item.description: In addition, improvement analysis shows that an increase in most motivators predicts an increase in general motivation.

item.title: Improving Continuous Sign Language Recognition with Adapted Image Models
item.description: Besides, fully fine-tuning the model easily forgets the generic essential knowledge acquired in the pretraining stage and overfits the downstream data.

item.title: MoPE: Mixture of Prefix Experts for Zero-Shot Dialogue State Tracking
item.description: Zero-shot dialogue state tracking (DST) transfers knowledge to unseen domains, reducing the cost of annotating new datasets.

item.title: Efficient Interactive LLM Serving with Proxy Model-based Sequence Length Prediction
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have been driving a new wave of interactive AI applications across numerous domains.

item.title: Training-free Boost for Open-Vocabulary Object Detection with Confidence Aggregation
item.description: Specifically, in the region-proposal stage, proposals that contain novel instances showcase lower objectness scores, since they are treated as background proposals during the training phase.

item.title: Enhancing Visual Question Answering through Question-Driven Image Captions as Prompts
item.description: This study explores the impact of incorporating image captioning as an intermediary process within the VQA pipeline.

item.title: EventEgo3D: 3D Human Motion Capture from Egocentric Event Streams
item.description: In response to the existing limitations, this paper 1) introduces a new problem, i. e., 3D human motion capture from an egocentric monocular event camera with a fisheye lens, and 2) proposes the first approach to it called EventEgo3D (EE3D).

item.title: Large-Scale Multi-Domain Recommendation: an Automatic Domain Feature Extraction and Personalized Integration Framework
item.description: Besides, by personalized integration of domain features from other domains for each user and the innovation in the training mode, the DFEI framework can yield more accurate conversion identification.

item.title: Direct May Not Be the Best: An Incremental Evolution View of Pose Generation
item.description: To deal with this challenge, we propose a fine-grained incremental evolution centered pose generation framework, rather than traditional direct one-to-one in a rush.

item.title: Shape Completion in the Dark: Completing Vertebrae Morphology from 3D Ultrasound
item.description: Purpose: Ultrasound (US) imaging, while advantageous for its radiation-free nature, is challenging to interpret due to only partially visible organs and a lack of complete 3D information.

item.title: Streaming detection of significant delay changes in public transport systems
item.description: The method we propose can be used with different change detectors, such as ADWIN, applied to location data stream shuffled to individual edges of a transport graph.

item.title: Homography Guided Temporal Fusion for Road Line and Marking Segmentation
item.description: Reliable segmentation of road lines and markings is critical to autonomous driving.

item.title: Any2Point: Empowering Any-modality Large Models for Efficient 3D Understanding
item.description: The adapter incorporates prior spatial knowledge from the source modality to guide the local feature aggregation of 3D tokens, compelling the semantic adaption of any-modality transformers.

item.title: Nostra Domina at EvaLatin 2024: Improving Latin Polarity Detection through Data Augmentation
item.description: This paper describes submissions from the team Nostra Domina to the EvaLatin 2024 shared task of emotion polarity detection.

item.title: NoticIA: A Clickbait Article Summarization Dataset in Spanish
item.description: We present NoticIA, a dataset consisting of 850 Spanish news articles featuring prominent clickbait headlines, each paired with high-quality, single-sentence generative summarizations written by humans.

item.title: Monte Carlo Tree Search with Boltzmann Exploration
item.description: Monte-Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) methods, such as Upper Confidence Bound applied to Trees (UCT), are instrumental to automated planning techniques.

item.title: Eliminating Catastrophic Overfitting Via Abnormal Adversarial Examples Regularization
item.description: Specifically, we design a novel method, termed Abnormal Adversarial Examples Regularization (AAER), which explicitly regularizes the variation of AAEs to hinder the classifier from becoming distorted.

item.title: DGMamba: Domain Generalization via Generalized State Space Model
item.description: SPR strives to encourage the model to concentrate more on objects rather than context, consisting of two designs: Prior-Free Scanning~(PFS), and Domain Context Interchange~(DCI).

item.title: Curated Datasets and Neural Models for Machine Translation of Informal Registers between Mayan and Spanish Vernaculars
item.description: The Mayan languages comprise a language family with an ancient history, millions of speakers, and immense cultural value, that, nevertheless, remains severely underrepresented in terms of resources and global exposure.

item.title: Scalable Language Model with Generalized Continual Learning
item.description: In this study, we introduce the Scalable Language Model (SLM) to overcome these limitations within a more challenging and generalized setting, representing a significant advancement toward practical applications for continual learning.

item.title: MindBridge: A Cross-Subject Brain Decoding Framework
item.description: Currently, brain decoding is confined to a per-subject-per-model paradigm, limiting its applicability to the same individual for whom the decoding model is trained.

item.title: ViM-UNet: Vision Mamba for Biomedical Segmentation
item.description: Here, we introduce ViM-UNet, a novel segmentation architecture based on it and compare it to UNet and UNETR for two challenging microscopy instance segmentation tasks.

item.title: Inferring Change Points in High-Dimensional Linear Regression via Approximate Message Passing
item.description: We consider the problem of localizing change points in high-dimensional linear regression.

item.title: HGRN2: Gated Linear RNNs with State Expansion
item.description: Hierarchically gated linear RNN (HGRN, Qin et al. 2023) has demonstrated competitive training speed and performance in language modeling, while offering efficient inference.

item.title: Data-Augmentation-Based Dialectal Adaptation for LLMs
item.description: We propose an approach that combines the strengths of different types of language models and leverages data augmentation techniques to improve task performance on three South Slavic dialects: Chakavian, Cherkano, and Torlak.

item.title: LLoCO: Learning Long Contexts Offline
item.description: We introduce LLoCO, a technique that combines context compression, retrieval, and parameter-efficient finetuning using LoRA.

item.title: AmpleGCG: Learning a Universal and Transferable Generative Model of Adversarial Suffixes for Jailbreaking Both Open and Closed LLMs
item.description: Moreover, we utilize those successful suffixes as training data to learn a generative model, named AmpleGCG, which captures the distribution of adversarial suffixes given a harmful query and enables the rapid generation of hundreds of suffixes for any harmful queries in seconds.

item.title: SFSORT: Scene Features-based Simple Online Real-Time Tracker
item.description: This paper introduces SFSORT, the world's fastest multi-object tracking system based on experiments conducted on MOT Challenge datasets.

item.title: Multi-view Aggregation Network for Dichotomous Image Segmentation
item.description: Dichotomous Image Segmentation (DIS) has recently emerged towards high-precision object segmentation from high-resolution natural images.

item.title: TBSN: Transformer-Based Blind-Spot Network for Self-Supervised Image Denoising
item.description: For channel self-attention, we observe that it may leak the blind-spot information when the channel number is greater than spatial size in the deep layers of multi-scale architectures.

item.title: UltraEval: A Lightweight Platform for Flexible and Comprehensive Evaluation for LLMs
item.description: The rapid development of LLMs calls for a lightweight and easy-to-use framework for swift evaluation deployment.
